oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A Commercially Available Siderophore-Receptor and Porin-Based Vaccine Reduces the Prevalence of E. coli 0157:H7 in the Feces of Beef Cattle under Field Conditions in 10 Commercial Feedlots
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Butler, B. A.
Thomson, D. U.
Loneragan, G. H.
Wileman, B. W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: feedlot
Siderophore Receptor and Porin
SRP
feces
beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Beef cattle located in 10 commercial feedlots were used to determine the efficacy of the Siderophore Receptor and Porin (SRP) E. coli 0157:H7 vaccine to decrease prevalence of E. coli 0157:H7 in the feces of beef cattle under natural conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 138
